result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca L. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/FT schooling or combination of the two, or for any time she does not meet that requirement, 10 hours community service per week.

Any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca L. Erickson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:35am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Pauline Toulouse.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Intentionally Take (<=$500)/Repeater)>>AMEND to DELETE Repeater allegation
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Intentionally Take (<=$550)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.
State and Atty Toulouse make argument on sentencing recommendation.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 9 months Probation
CNDITIONS: ANy assessment treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; FTE/FT schooling or combination of the two, or for any time she does not meet that requirement, 10 hours of c.s./week; CC; Restitution of to Kwik Trip of $31.59 within first month of probation

Adj: 9:57am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:50am
State appears by ADA C.Minder. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Toulouse.


Parties note agreement has NOT been reached in this matter.

COURT leaves FPT/JT dates on court's calendar
Bond continues.

Adj: 10:51am

Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2015 at 03:50 pm.
Plea hearing on May 28, 2015 at 10:40 am.
Final pre-trial on June 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Jury Trial on July 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   No contact with victim(s): Kwik Trip (any). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
